Bash(RAILS_ENV=test bundle exec rails runner "
# I18n ãƒ¢ã‚¸ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã®ãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ã‚¨ã‚¤ãƒªã‚¢ã‚¹ã‚’ç¢ºèª
puts ''=== I18n module methods ===''
puts ""I18n.respond_to?(:t): #{I18n.respond_to?(:t)}""
puts ""I18n.respond_to?(:translate): #{I18n.respond_to?(:translate)}""
puts ""I18n.respond_to?(:l): #{I18n.respond_to?(:l)}""
puts ""I18n.respond_to?(:localize): #{I18n.respond_to?(:localize)}""
puts ''''
puts ''=== Test I18n.t vs I18n.l ===''
begin
  puts ""I18n.t(:field_login): #{I18n.t(:field_login)}""
rescue => e
  puts ""I18n.t(:field_login) ERROR: #{e.message}""
end

begin
  puts ""I18n.l(:field_login): #{I18n.l(:field_login)}""
rescue => e
  puts ""I18n.l(:field_login) ERROR: #{e.class.name}: #{e.message}""
end
")

Bash(RAILS_ENV=test bundle exec rails runner "
# ãƒ“ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã‚’ãƒ¬ãƒ³ãƒ€ãƒªãƒ³ã‚°ã—ã¦ã¿ã‚‹
require ''action_view''
require ''action_controller''

class TestController < ApplicationController
  def test_render
    render inline: ''<%= l(:field_login) %>'', layout: false
  end
end

controller = TestController.new
controller.request = ActionController::TestRequest.create
controller.response = ActionController::TestResponse.new

begin
  controller.process(:test_render)
  puts ''=== Rendering Success ===''
  puts controller.response.body
rescue => e
  puts ''=== Rendering ERROR ===''
  puts ""#{e.class.name}: #{e.message}""
  puts e.backtrace.first(5).join(""\n"")
end
")

Bash(env RAILS_ENV=test bundle exec rails runner "
project = Project.create!(name: ''Test'', identifier: ''test-#{Time.now.to_i}'')
tracker = Tracker.first
parent = Issue.create!(subject: ''Parent'', project: project, tracker: tracker, author: User.first, status: IssueStatus.first)
child = Issue.create!(subject: ''Child'', project: project, tracker: tracker, author: User.first, status: IssueStatus.first, parent_issue_id: parent.id)

puts ""Parent issue: #{parent.id}""
puts ""Child issue: #{child.id}""
puts ""Child''s parent: #{child.parent&.id}""
puts ""Parent.children method exists: #{parent.respond_to?(:children)}""

if parent.respond_to?(:children)
  puts ""Children: #{parent.children.pluck(:id)}""
else
  puts ''No children method available''
end
")

Bash(env RAILS_ENV=test bundle exec rails runner "
project = FactoryBot.create(:project)
user = FactoryBot.create(:user)
role = FactoryBot.create(:role, permissions: [:view_issues, :add_issues, :edit_issues, :manage_versions])
member = FactoryBot.create(:member, project: project, user: user, roles: [role])

User.current = user

puts ''=== Version creation test ===''
version_params = { name: ''v1.0.0'', description: ''Test version'', effective_date: ''2025-12-31'', status: ''open'' }
version = project.versions.build(version_params)
puts ""Version valid? #{version.valid?}""
puts ""Errors: #{version.errors.full_messages}"" unless version.valid?

if version.save
  puts ""âœ… Version created: #{version.name}""
else
  puts ""âŒ Save failed: #{version.errors.full_messages}""
end
")

Bash(env RAILS_ENV=test bundle exec rails runner "
# Simulate the permission check
project = Project.first || Project.create!(name: ''Test'', identifier: ''test'')
user = User.where(''login LIKE ?'', ''user%'').first || User.create!(login: ''testuser'', firstname: ''Test'', lastname: ''User'', mail: ''test@example.com'')
User.current = user

begin
  raise EpicGrid::PermissionDenied.new(''add_issues'', project)
rescue EpicGrid::PermissionDenied => e
  puts ''âœ… Exception caught successfully''
  puts ""Permission: #{e.permission}""
  puts ""Resource: #{e.resource}""
  puts ""Message: #{e.message}""
rescue => e
  puts ""âŒ Caught different exception: #{e.class.name}""
  puts ""Message: #{e.message}""
end
")
